clinical_study.brief_title: Mechanisms of Stroke in Intracranial Stenosis
clinical_study.official_title: Mechanisms of Stroke in Intracranial Stenosis and Stenting

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this SAMMPRIS-affiliated study is to understand the mechanisms the mechanisms that underlie ischemic stroke recurrence in high-grade intracranial atherosclerotic disease in order to determine predictors of recurrent stroke. MoSIS will evaluate 6 specific mechanisms of stroke in the medically-treated SAMMPRIS cohort: decreased antegrade flow, progression of stenosis, decreased proximal collateral flow, decreased distal collateral flow, impaired cerebrovascular reserve, and artery-to-artery embolism.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The affiliated study SAMMPRIS (Stenting and Aggressive Medical Management for Preventing Recurrent stroke in Intracranial Stenosis) has stopped enrollment.

primary_outcome.measure: Ischemic stroke in the territory of the stenotic artery

study_pop.textblock: Medical arm of the SAMMPRIS trial which includes recently symptomatic (<30 days) high grade (70% or more)intracranial stenosis of the carotid, middle cerebral, vertebral or basilar arteries.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled in the medical arm of SAMMPRIS, signed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- For QMRA testing: contraindications to MRI; for TCD testing, abscence of ultrasonographic windows.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor of Neurology. Director of Cerebrovascular Division

clinical_study.keyword: Symptomatic intracranial atherosclerotic disease enrolled in the medical arm of SAMMPRIS
